Imports

asynciobase, ../private/buffer, ../private/asynctwoend, ../private/asynciochilds_posix

Types

AsyncBuffer = ref object of AsyncIoBase
  stream*: AsyncIoBase
An object that allow to bufferize other AsyncIoBase objects. Slower for local files Source   Edit   
AsyncChainReader = ref object of AsyncIoBase
An object that allows to read each stream one after another in order Source   Edit   
AsyncIoDelayed = ref object of AsyncIoBase
An object that permits to add a delay before each read or write is executed Source   Edit   
AsyncStream = ref object of AsyncTwoEnd

An in-memory async buffer

Because it is async (read pending for data), it can be highly subjects to deadlocks. To avoid deadlocks: ensure to a least close writer when finished. Not thread safe

Source   Edit   
AsyncStreamReader = ref object of AsyncIoBase
Reader object of AsyncStream. Can't be instantiated directly Source   Edit   
AsyncStreamWriter = ref object of AsyncIoBase
Writer object of AsyncStream. Can't be instantiated directly Source   Edit   
AsyncString = ref object of AsyncStreamReader

Immutable async stream/buffer, that can only be written at instantiation

No deadlock is possible

Source   Edit   
AsyncTeeReader = ref object of AsyncIoBase

Object that allows to clone/tee data when reading it

Meaning that reading from it will both read (and return) from underlying reader, and write the data to the underlying writer

Source   Edit   
AsyncTeeWriter = ref object of AsyncIoBase
  writers*: seq[AsyncIoBase]
Object that allows to clone data written to it to multiple writers Source   Edit   
AsyncVoid = ref object of AsyncIoBase
Does nothing and can only be written to. Equivalent of a /dev/null, write to it will do nothing Source   Edit  

Consts

defaultAsyncBufferSize = 1024

           tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

    ...raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
Empty all data in the internal memory. it doesn't flush the wrapped stream Source   Edit
